intro: Mastigion putidum, commonly known as the stinkwood tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by spiny, berry-like fruits. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed. The tree is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance in its native habitat.
